title: Pratt Architecture's story of innovation shines through in 70th anniversary exhibition
author: Josh Niland
excerpt: The Pratt Institute School of Architecture is celebrating its 70th anniversary this spring with a special month-long exhibition highlighting the rather extraordinary contributions Pratt students, alumni, and faculty have bequeathed to the world since 1954. All of the materials featured...

html:
• anchor

    Installation view, '70 Years [+] Pratt School of Architecture: An Ongoing Story.' Photo by Quilian Riano

    The Pratt Institute School of Architecture is celebrating its 70th anniversary this spring with a special month-long exhibition highlighting the rather extraordinary contributions Pratt students, alumni, and faculty have bequeathed to the world since 1954. 

    All of the materials featured, which the school has labeled a retrospective "first step" preceding a turn to its bright future, are taken from the Pratt Institute Library archives and will be on display through April 25th. It also coincides with an exhibition of student work from the B.Arch and M.Arch programs that was organized to be showcased during an NAAB accreditation visit and offers an "exciting view of the dynamic community of these two professional degrees."

    70 Years [+] Pratt School of Architecture: An Ongoing Story can be viewed in the Leo J. Kuhn Lobby at Higgins Hal daily from 9 AM until 5 PM.
